text: Dionigi Tettamanzi (14 March 1934 â€“ 5 August 2017) was an Italian prelate of the Roman Catholic Church. He was named a cardinal in 1998. He was Archbishop of Genoa from 1995 to 2002 and Archbishop of Milan from 2002 to 2011. He was born in Renate, Italy. Tettamanzi was one of the cardinal electors who participated in the 2013 papal conclave that selected Pope Francis. Tettamanzi died at his home in Triuggio, Italy on 5 August 2017 at the age of 83. ==References== ==Other websites== *Archdiocese of Milan Category:1934 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Italian cardinals Category:Italian Roman Catholic archbishops
title: Dionigi Tettamanzi
